name: hereditarily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of characteristics or diseases) from the genes of a parent to a child, or (of titles and positions in society) from parent to a child as a right: Male pattern baldness is transmitted hereditarily by way of the X chromosome inherited from the man's mother. The crown is passed down hereditarily, with the eldest child of the deceased or abdicating ruler being the next in line to receive it. Related word
hereditary
More examplesFewer examplesI think that his talent for knowing where to find a good parking spot might have been hereditarily passed from his father. The country is hereditarily ruled, with a line of kings dating back to the Middle Ages.
